docs.lead_paragraph: Gay and lesbian individuals are less prepared financially for retirement than their straight counterparts, according to an exclusive analysis by The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research.
docs.snippet: Gay and lesbian individuals are less prepared financially for retirement than their straight counterparts, according to an exclusive analysis by The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's executive order to spare some immigrants from deportation has galvanized Democrats, immigration groups and health care advocates in California to push for expanding health coverage to a segment of the population that remains uninsured.

headline.main: California Pushes to Expand Immigrant Health Care
headline.print_headline: California Pushes to Expand Immigrant Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans say Congress never appropriated money for a provision of the Affordable Care Act that offers financial assistance to low- and moderate-income people.

headline.main: Suit on Health Law Puts Focus on Funding Powers
headline.print_headline: Suit on Health Law Puts Focus on Funding Powers

docs.abstract: House Republicans, in latest lawsuit challenging Affordable Care Act, are focusing on little-noticed provision of law offering financial assistance to low- and moderate-income people; argue that Obama administration required, but was never granted, appropriation from Congress to reimburse insurers for reducing costs for some health plan customers.
docs.snippet: House Republicans say Congress never appropriated money for a provision of the Affordable Care Act that offers financial assistance to low- and moderate-income people.

docs.lead_paragraph: A mine fire in May killed 301 men, making it the worst industrial disaster in Turkish history. This is the story of two men who lived through it.

headline.main: The Mine Disaster That Shook Turkey
headline.print_headline: ‘It Had the Strange Light of Hell’

docs.abstract: Story of two of survivors of devastating coal mine fire in Soma, Turkey, in May that killed 301 men reveals hazardous working conditions of miners in the country; disaster has been a reckoning for Turkey's economic system and its injustices.
docs.snippet: A mine fire in May killed 301 men, making it the worst industrial disaster in Turkish history. This is the story of two men who lived through it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Had he stayed in Russia, Andrew Mironov would be settling in to a stable job with an oil company, likely with a newly awarded doctoral degree in electrical engineering.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leading U.S. CEOs, angered by the Obama administration's challenge to certain "workplace wellness" programs, are threatening to side with anti-Obamacare forces unless the government backs off, according to people familiar with the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: An offshoot of the sharing economy, virtual villages are popping up all over the country to offer older adults access to resources and social connections that help them age in place.

headline.main: Retirees Turn to Virtual Villages for Mutual Support
headline.print_headline: Retirees Turn to Virtual Villages for Mutual Support

docs.abstract: Retiring column; virtual retirement villages like Capital City Village, which was started in Austin, Tex, by divorced retiree Rick Cloud, are popping up all over the country; virtual villages are low-cost ways to age in place and delay going to costly assisted-living facilities.
docs.snippet: An offshoot of the sharing economy, virtual villages are popping up all over the country to offer older adults access to resources and social connections that help them age in place.
